critique: The document describes a specific case of reinstating a widowed woman, Mrs. Fern A. Black, to her former clerical position in the Los Angeles post office. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy, as the reinstatement provides her with means of support for herself and her two minor children. There is also an element of sadness due to the death of her husband. There is no indication of anger, fear, disgust, or surprise.
